newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds fall in thin market activity.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds fall in thin market activity.

text.p: Argentine bonds fell in thin volumes Friday as the market finally succumbed to a bout of profit-taking after its recent gains.
"Prices are adjusting slowly which is healthy for the market but the profit-taking took place amid very thin volumes so there was no big fall-out," said a trader.
Argentina's FRB Brady bond due 2005 fell 1/4 to 91-1/2, while the dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 was flat at 126.50.
"The thin volumes meant the price action was not very indicative" of the market general trend, said another trader.
Trade was subdued by the early closure of the U.S. Treasuries market for the Presidents Day holiday on Monday, when activity was seen remaining thin.

Players said the market's next big point of focus was Tuesday's auction of $500 million Bonte Treasury bonds. The sale will expand the size of the two-year Bonte first issued in December to a total of $1.0 billion.
In the money markets, call money rates rose to 6.53 percent from 6.48 percent.
